Of the credit lines of PTE 4 billion made available to companies last week as a way of mitigating and combating the effects of COVID-19 on the Cape Verdean economy, over PTE 1 billion has already been requested by around 500 companies.

Moratorium on interest payments extended to City Councils and all those who have an insurance contract, will have an additional period of 60 days, so that they can proceed with the payment of their commitments.

Enforcing Decree-Law No. 38/2020 on April 1, 2020 (runs until September 30, 2020), to alleviate any difficulties in the normal fulfilment of the payment obligations of debtors in the banking system (https: //www.bcv.cv)
S9_Notes: The World Bank Board of Executive Directors approved today a $5 million credit from the International Development Association (IDA)* to support the Archipelago of Cabo Verde in strengthening its preparedness and response to the COVID-19 pandemic.
S10_Notes:
Since 16 March tests are being made in Cape Verde rather than abroad, by the Laboratório de Virologia de Cabo Verde, in Praia. The Cape Verde Virology Laboratory, which began conducting screening tests for the new coronavirus on Saturday, has the capacity to perform up to 300 daily tests and make the results available within 24 hours, an official source said today. 

Source: https://www.asemana.publ.cv/?Laboratorio-de-Cabo-Verde-com-capacidade-para-300-testes-diarios&ak=1
S12_Notes: Takes 24 hours to receive the outcome of the test although the test can be done in 3 hours. Started in 16 March 2020

S1_Notes:
Cape Verde government announced school closures for all and public schools in the country. Not covered by this measure, according to a government source, are the daycare centers that receive children between 0 and 3 years old, because they “belong to the care network” and, therefore, the decision will be up to the administration of each daycare center.

Source: http://capeverdehub.com/2020/03/19/cape-verde-closes-all-public-schools-amid-covid-19-pandemic/
S3_Notes:
Boa Vista under quarantine

https://www.governo.cv/
S4_Notes:
Local public transport allowed to operate at a reduced level of service.

Source: https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/328671/cape-verde-authorities-declare-nationwide-state-of-emergency-in-place-until-april-17-update-3
S6_Notes: Drafted on Saturday, March 28 but came into force on April 1 and would remain till at least April 17 2020. All citizens have been instructed to remain at home unless they need to carry out essential activities such as buying goods or other essential items, going to work (if unable to work from home), hospitals, or health centres, caring for an individual and walking pets
S7_Notes:
Effective 3/18/2020 all air connections from all European countries including Portugal are prohibited according to information from the Government of Cape Verde. The USA, Brazil and in certain African countries including Senegal and Nigeria.
Source: http://capeverdehub.com/2020/03/18/cape-verde-bans-travel-from-the-usa-and-european-countries-due-to-covid-19-epidemic/
Revised draft on Saturday, March 28 but came into force on April 1 and would remain till at least April 17 2020.  No commercial flights out of Cape Verde and all inter-island flights have been suspended until at least April 17. The Cape Verdean authorities have also closed all sea borders. Exceptions are for cargo flights and flights for foreign citizens wishing to return home.
S8_Notes:
Reported on 27 March 2020.

Bank of Cabo Verde provides €400 million to banks in response to Covid-19. Reduction of the benchmark interest rate by 125 basis points, from 1.5% to 0.25%.

Reduction in the rate of the permanent loan liquidity facility by 250 basis points, from 3% to 0.5%.

Established a credit line for banks, via the Long Term Financing Monetary Operation (OMF), with special conditions, at an interest rate of 0.75%.

Reduction in the permanent liquidity absorption rate by five basis points, from 0.1% to 0.05%.

Source: https://macauhub.com.mo/2020/03/27/pt-banco-de-cabo-verde-disponibiliza-400-milhoes-de-euros-a-banca-em-resposta-ao-covid-19/

The Cape Verde Virology Laboratory, which began conducting screening tests for the new coronavirus on Saturday, has the capacity to perform up to 300 daily tests and make the results available within 24 hours, an official source said today. 

Source: https://www.asemana.publ.cv/?Laboratorio-de-Cabo-Verde-com-capacidade-para-300-testes-diarios&ak=1
S12_Notes: Takes 24 hours to receive the outcome of the test although the test can be done in 3 hours. Started in 16 March 2020

S1_Notes:
Cape Verde government announced school closures for all and public schools in the country. Not covered by this measure, according to a government source, are the daycare centers that receive children between 0 and 3 years old, because they “belong to the care network” and, therefore, the decision will be up to the administration of each daycare center.

Source: http://capeverdehub.com/2020/03/19/cape-verde-closes-all-public-schools-amid-covid-19-pandemic/
S3_Notes:
Boa Vista under quarantine

https://www.governo.cv/
S4_Notes:
Local public transport allowed to operate at a reduced level of service.

Source: https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/328671/cape-verde-authorities-declare-nationwide-state-of-emergency-in-place-until-april-17-update-3
S6_Notes: Drafted on Saturday, March 28 but came into force on April 1 and would remain till at least April 17 2020. All citizens have been instructed to remain at home unless they need to carry out essential activities such as buying goods or other essential items, going to work (if unable to work from home), hospitals, or health centres, caring for an individual and walking pets
S7_Notes:
Effective 3/18/2020 all air connections from all European countries including Portugal are prohibited according to information from the Government of Cape Verde. The USA, Brazil and in certain African countries including Senegal and Nigeria.
Source: http://capeverdehub.com/2020/03/18/cape-verde-bans-travel-from-the-usa-and-european-countries-due-to-covid-19-epidemic/
Revised draft on Saturday, March 28 but came into force on April 1 and would remain till at least April 17 2020.  No commercial flights out of Cape Verde and all inter-island flights have been suspended until at least April 17. The Cape Verdean authorities have also closed all sea borders. Exceptions are for cargo flights and flights for foreign citizens wishing to return home.
S8_Notes:
Reported on 27 March 2020.

Bank of Cabo Verde provides €400 million to banks in response to Covid-19. Reduction of the benchmark interest rate by 125 basis points, from 1.5% to 0.25%.

Reduction in the rate of the permanent loan liquidity facility by 250 basis points, from 3% to 0.5%.

Established a credit line for banks, via the Long Term Financing Monetary Operation (OMF), with special conditions, at an interest rate of 0.75%.

Reduction in the permanent liquidity absorption rate by five basis points, from 0.1% to 0.05%.

Source: https://macauhub.com.mo/2020/03/27/pt-banco-de-cabo-verde-disponibiliza-400-milhoes-de-euros-a-banca-em-resposta-ao-covid-19/

Reported on 13-14 April 2020
Of the credit lines of PTE 4 billion made available to companies last week as a way of mitigating and combating the effects of COVID-19 on the Cape Verdean economy, over PTE 1 billion has already been requested by around 500 companies.

Moratorium on interest payments extended to City Councils and all those who have an insurance contract, will have an additional period of 60 days, so that they can proceed with the payment of their commitments.

Enforcing Decree-Law No. 38/2020 on April 1, 2020 (runs until September 30, 2020), to alleviate any difficulties in the normal fulfilment of the payment obligations of debtors in the banking system (https: //www.bcv.cv)
S9_Notes: The World Bank Board of Executive Directors approved today a $5 million credit from the International Development Association (IDA)* to support the Archipelago of Cabo Verde in strengthening its preparedness and response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

S4_Notes:
Local public transport allowed to operate at a reduced level of service.

Source: https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/328671/cape-verde-authorities-declare-nationwide-state-of-emergency-in-place-until-april-17-update-3
S6_Notes: Drafted on Saturday, March 28 but came into force on April 1 and would remain till at least April 17 2020. All citizens have been instructed to remain at home unless they need to carry out essential activities such as buying goods or other essential items, going to work (if unable to work from home), hospitals, or health centres, caring for an individual and walking pets
S7_Notes:
Effective 3/18/2020 all air connections from all European countries including Portugal are prohibited according to information from the Government of Cape Verde. The USA, Brazil and in certain African countries including Senegal and Nigeria.
Source: http://capeverdehub.com/2020/03/18/cape-verde-bans-travel-from-the-usa-and-european-countries-due-to-covid-19-epidemic/
Revised draft on Saturday, March 28 but came into force on April 1 and would remain till at least April 17 2020.  No commercial flights out of Cape Verde and all inter-island flights have been suspended until at least April 17. The Cape Verdean authorities have also closed all sea borders. Exceptions are for cargo flights and flights for foreign citizens wishing to return home.
S8_Notes:
Reported on 27 March 2020.

Bank of Cabo Verde provides €400 million to banks in response to Covid-19. Reduction of the benchmark interest rate by 125 basis points, from 1.5% to 0.25%.

Reduction in the rate of the permanent loan liquidity facility by 250 basis points, from 3% to 0.5%.

Established a credit line for banks, via the Long Term Financing Monetary Operation (OMF), with special conditions, at an interest rate of 0.75%.

Reduction in the permanent liquidity absorption rate by five basis points, from 0.1% to 0.05%.

Source: https://macauhub.com.mo/2020/03/27/pt-banco-de-cabo-verde-disponibiliza-400-milhoes-de-euros-a-banca-em-resposta-ao-covid-19/

Reported on 13-14 April 2020
Of the credit lines of PTE 4 billion made available to companies last week as a way of mitigating and combating the effects of COVID-19 on the Cape Verdean economy, over PTE 1 billion has already been requested by around 500 companies.

Moratorium on interest payments extended to City Councils and all those who have an insurance contract, will have an additional period of 60 days, so that they can proceed with the payment of their commitments.

Enforcing Decree-Law No. 38/2020 on April 1, 2020 (runs until September 30, 2020), to alleviate any difficulties in the normal fulfilment of the payment obligations of debtors in the banking system (https: //www.bcv.cv)
S9_Notes: The World Bank Board of Executive Directors approved today a $5 million credit from the International Development Association (IDA)* to support the Archipelago of Cabo Verde in strengthening its preparedness and response to the COVID-19 pandemic.
S10_Notes:
Since 16 March tests are being made in Cape Verde rather than abroad, by the Laboratório de Virologia de Cabo Verde, in Praia. The Cape Verde Virology Laboratory, which began conducting screening tests for the new coronavirus on Saturday, has the capacity to perform up to 300 daily tests and make the results available within 24 hours, an official source said today. 

Source: https://www.asemana.publ.cv/?Laboratorio-de-Cabo-Verde-com-capacidade-para-300-testes-diarios&ak=1
S12_Notes: Takes 24 hours to receive the outcome of the test although the test can be done in 3 hours. Started in 16 March 2020

S1_Notes:
Cape Verde government announced school closures for all and public schools in the country. Not covered by this measure, according to a government source, are the daycare centers that receive children between 0 and 3 years old, because they “belong to the care network” and, therefore, the decision will be up to the administration of each daycare center.

Source: http://capeverdehub.com/2020/03/19/cape-verde-closes-all-public-schools-amid-covid-19-pandemic/

No commercial flights out of Cape Verde and all inter-island flights have been suspended until at least April 17. The Cape Verdean authorities have also closed all sea borders. Exceptions are for cargo flights and flights for foreign citizens wishing to return home.
S8_Notes:
Reported on 27 March 2020.

Bank of Cabo Verde provides €400 million to banks in response to Covid-19. Reduction of the benchmark interest rate by 125 basis points, from 1.5% to 0.25%.

Reduction in the rate of the permanent loan liquidity facility by 250 basis points, from 3% to 0.5%.

Established a credit line for banks, via the Long Term Financing Monetary Operation (OMF), with special conditions, at an interest rate of 0.75%.

Reduction in the permanent liquidity absorption rate by five basis points, from 0.1% to 0.05%.

Source: https://macauhub.com.mo/2020/03/27/pt-banco-de-cabo-verde-disponibiliza-400-milhoes-de-euros-a-banca-em-resposta-ao-covid-19/

Reported on 13-14 April 2020
Of the credit lines of PTE 4 billion made available to companies last week as a way of mitigating and combating the effects of COVID-19 on the Cape Verdean economy, over PTE 1 billion has already been requested by around 500 companies.

Moratorium on interest payments extended to City Councils and all those who have an insurance contract, will have an additional period of 60 days, so that they can proceed with the payment of their commitments.

Enforcing Decree-Law No. 38/2020 on April 1, 2020 (runs until September 30, 2020), to alleviate any difficulties in the normal fulfilment of the payment obligations of debtors in the banking system (https: //www.bcv.cv)
S9_Notes: The World Bank Board of Executive Directors approved today a $5 million credit from the International Development Association (IDA)* to support the Archipelago of Cabo Verde in strengthening its preparedness and response to the COVID-19 pandemic.
S10_Notes:
Since 16 March tests are being made in Cape Verde rather than abroad, by the Laboratório de Virologia de Cabo Verde, in Praia. The Cape Verde Virology Laboratory, which began conducting screening tests for the new coronavirus on Saturday, has the capacity to perform up to 300 daily tests and make the results available within 24 hours, an official source said today. 

Source: https://www.asemana.publ.cv/?Laboratorio-de-Cabo-Verde-com-capacidade-para-300-testes-diarios&ak=1
S12_Notes: Takes 24 hours to receive the outcome of the test although the test can be done in 3 hours. Started in 16 March 2020
